comment: Just an update - Vermillion has taken a position at a school in Texas, so he won't be teaching at KSU any longer.

Pretty easy A. As others have said, he is pretty monotone.  The first test is a little difficult due to the chemistry involved, but nothing overwhelming. I noted in my class the ones freaking out about tests were the ones who started studying 20 minutes before the test.  Gee, I wonder why they were freaking out....

I'm registered for Professor Vermillion's 1102 class this Spring after attending his 1101 class. Yes his lectures are boring, but he isn't the only instructor that can tuck you in. I'm now familiar with his system and what he expects and am looking forward to another A this semester. Study all the test materials and do the labs ASAP in 1101.

No need to attend class at all. In fact I learned more studying his powerpoints in my home than sitting in his lecture hall while he talks about vaguely related topics - softly, WITHOUT a mic. I'm thankful for how easy it was (no attendance policy, drop lowest test grade, straightforward tests) but for an advanced kid like me this is torture.AVOID!

hands down the worst professor I've ever had. reclines in class, monotone boring lectures that he reads directly from the ppt. refuses to use the university website. uses a personal website that is unorganized and just a link to other websites. doesnt do any actual teaching and I'm curious as to why he is still teaching at this school. AVOID!!!!
Professor has changed the test, please study for the test, you will make a B!!!

Easy A. He has an account on Scribd.com that he's proud about. On scribd, you will find his old tests which are identical to the exams. Don't go to class, sleep in and get and A. Easiest class I've ever taken. It's seriously a 3rd grade level class.

This prof is useless.  Will not use vista, uses another site that is unorganized.  LOTS (a whole ream of paper) of printing if you want to follow lectures. Lectures are BORING.  Tests are difficult.  No test prep/study guide.  You have no idea what to expect on the tests.  Only 2 test grades and 1 homework grade.

Boring jerk that is not helpful at all. Uses his own website instead of Vista & changes his due dates around. Takes forever to respond to e-mails & assignments are not in order (i.e Assignment 6 & 7 are due 1st, then 3 & 4, etc.) Needs to stick to real estate.

I got an A. I attended 7 of 16 classes. I made an 85 and 89 on the 1st 2 exams. Got 6 of 10 ext cd pts by attendance. And completed 4 of 12 labs (worth 30%). The math doesn't add up.  I shouldn't have gotten an A. Take this class! It's boring, but if you do 50% of the work and follow his directions on the lab, you are likely to get an A.
This class sucked. Taught totally of the powerpoints, which didnt really make much sense. The tests were ridiculously difficult. STAY AWAY!!!!!!

Not an easy class. You WILL have to work for your grade. There are three test but he drops the lowest. I only took two of them, if you study every single note and movie quiz, power point, and study guide you will get a good grade. No book..at all.

Class isn't that bad but extremely boring. He seems to be a nice enough guy but has no personality, just reads from his powerpoint Ben Stein style. There is no outside work and he drops the lowest test so you can get a B with minimal effort.
His final is 40-50 SHORT ANSWER questions.  Really? Don't take this class, you spend way too much time memorizing crap you learned in 7th grade life science.  I can't believe this course exists.

This guy seems super cool and very nice at first. On stage, addressing an audience, he is amiable. One on one, he's a huge d*ck and acts annoyed that you're bothering him. Tests are much harder than they should be for a freaking 101 gen ed. course. Questions are easy but you must know a TON of information to cover everything. I would not recommend.

I can't believe ppl complain about this class being boring with some of the pain in the butt classes out there, especially when attendance isn't mandatory. He doesn't demand much, at all. Everything you need is on scribd. A very small amount of effort goes a long way. Don't buy the book, you will never use it.

I took him for 1101 and 1102. BORING lectures, made me want to sleep every time. Tests are based on his PowerPoints. Gives "pop quizzes" that are worth extra credit for attendance which definitely helps your grade in the end. Easy A, but always be on time for tests!

I literally never go to this class but to take the tests.  He puts everything online, TONS of worksheets but he always posts keys and/or the powerpoints they're from.  He's pretty boring and has a hissy fit if you walk in 2 mins late for a test, but otherwise better than what I've heard of other profs as far as easiness goes.

Great teacher! Really nice. Go to the classes because he gives random bonus points and you can earn up to 10. Don't need the book, he has his own website with everything on it. Drops lowest test grade.

Mr. Vermillion is an extremely nice man. He really cares about his students succeeding. I had a serious medical issue & he really worked with me. His tests are usually multiple choice & give bonus points at random. I would defintely recommend to anyone.

Book was not required.  He has his own website where files are downloaded.  Knows his stuff!  Goes into a lot of detail on every slide.  Takes best grade from exams 1 and 2.  Exam 3 is final.  Extra credit offered if in class.  Willing to help.  Boring subject.

Whew! That was close! You have to teach yourself! Only good thing is you do not need a book. Would not have attended if it were not for the random extra points for attendence. He mumbles and reads powerpoints.  Memorize every vocab/powerpoint slide, study guide and you will be fine. I recieved an A, and promise it was due to pure  memorization.
Good Teacher, I would take him again for another class. U don't need the book.
Amazing professor. I would retake him again if he were teaching other science classes. Everything is on power points, the movies are interesting, and he loves science. Take Him!

It's going to be a lot of info no matter who you take so just don't procrastinate. 2 tests and a final, grade is highest test and final. 10pts extra credit. Check his scribd accound on the shelf for all the powerpoints, and check his personal site for what u need to know on the tests. VERY kind person and he is very helpful if you talk to him. :)
the course is pretty easy with some extra credit opportunities.  But if you think just cause you got an A on the first test you and skip class til the final then you probably are mistaken.
A nice guy but VERY boring...shows alot of movies(unit 1 movies are painful but they get better)...if you can stay awake during his lectures and study jst alittle,you should get a B

I took the Saturday class which is a no. Luckily he puts all lectures and videos (with notes) online. Theres no need to go to class unless you want extra credit, but make sure you go the first couple of days to get the online info.
Yes, he is very boring and his test are the same! Gives study guides that do not pertain to test! Be aware that he pull ALL his questions from the powerpoint slides and not his study guides.

TAKE HIM! he is direct and informative. His class is perfect for students with multiple commitments. He is fair and his grading policy is straight forward 3 test in all 2 graded and follow the lab instructions and you will pass...class over go do something positive in life.
He is not boring, just really smart!  I really liked him and thought his class was run efficiently.

SO BORING! All powerpoints are online so you are tempted to not go.  If you do skip, you miss videos & other random info he'll include on tests. You also have to attend to do extra credit. Grade is based on only 2 tests and there is SO MUCH information on each, but only 35-45 questions.  Got an A, but I fought hard for it. Avoid him- take Simpson!

Very boring. Avoid the saturday class as 3 hours of powerpoint lectures was terrible. All the powerpoints are online. Do the labs as it boosts your grade. Tests are hard but studying should get you a B.
the class could be boring. make sure you do all the labs because its a pretty good boost in your grades. do well on the first test because the second was kinda hard.

Try to avoid this professor. He is extremely boring! There are only 2 test in the class, but there is so much content on each test that it is impossible to memorize everything, & he puts some random questions on tests. Not an easy class. Communication is awful with him! Takes days 2 get his one worded email replies.

Try to avoid this professor. He is extremely boring, but attendance is not mandatory. There are only 2 test in the class, but there is so much content on each test that it is impossible to memorize everything, & he puts some random questions on tests. Not an easy class. Communication is awful with him! Takes days 2 get his one worded email replies.

does not use vista. makes it difficult to communicate with him unless through email. hard to keep up with grades. notes are very broad. uses scribd for files which are formatted strangely on the website and a bit difficult to read. would not suggest him!

incredibly boring prof, very monotone, no personality, a bit rude at times. reads directly from powerpoint. everything you need posted online do NOT buy book. drops lowest test, except final. very nit picky on directions. gives random ec for attendance. i wouldn't suggest him. you must be VERY self motivated to do very well.
I loved this teacher.  His test are fair and he gives you everything you need to pass.

This guy just loves being a science nerd!! He says that he will work with the tests when emergencies presence at an instant, but so far he has not presented himself in a helping mood. Specially folks for us in the military that everyone works around, this guy just says NO to everything. Forget his promises and doesnt work with you much!

Uses personal website and posts long powerpoints (20-80+ pages). Class is boring. Some extra credit given for attendance, randomly. Reads from powerpoints almost exclusively. Tests can cover ANYTHING in the powerpoints, even the 5th largest company of 2007 in terms of sales. Self-motivation required. Labs are 25% of the grade. Drops lowest test.

he isn't a horrible teacher but his class is very boring. He is also very vague about what's going to be on his tests. If you can get a different professor i would but if you have to take him you have to be self motivated, study everything he gives you in detail. Also he doesn't make you but attend his classes because he sometimes gives extra credi

this guy is a horrible teacher. also kindve a ****. refuses to use vista, instead his own personal website which is poorly implemented alongside scribd. but, it was easy, I just thought  this could've been a fun class.

Don't buy the book, everything you need is posted online. He gives unit study guides, which really sum up well what you should know. Not the easiest subject on earth, but he doesn't make it too hard, just a little boring. Review your notes & know the study guide & you'll be fine. Gives extra credit points on each test from a specific online article
I only attended classes on test days, and made an A. He puts everything on the web, and I never even bought the textbook. Piece of cake class.

He posts all notes online and never uses the book so save yourself $200. I never go to class, I just study before the tests. He gives two tests and takes the higher grade plus the final, so you only have 2 grades. Final isn't cumulative. Not stressful at all. My first test was very high so I didn't even take test #2. Just study online.

DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!!! It was the biggest waste of $200. We do not use it at all. The classes are super boring! Reads straight from his notes, that he does provide for you on his personal website. There are three tests, but he drops your lowest grade.

I loved this class, yet I hate science. There should be no negative feedback for this prof or class unless you did not show up for lecture. Everything is from his own website, study guides provided, videos, extra credit points. He does two tests and drops the lowest +final, so your grade is based 50/50 from the two. All you have to do is study.

Nice guy.  Lectures are not bad considering it is science and to 300 students.  I don't think anyone can make it extremely interesting.  He does show videos that help break up the monotony.  Test are not the easiest.  Only gives 2 (takes highest) and the final.  Come to class and get easy extra points.  Does NOT use book at all!

nice professor BUT he is very boring and tests are hard. he gives 2 tests and a final. he drops the lowest test grade so it's really a test and a final. almost all questions come from the book but he tells you they are from his powerpoints.

I do not recommend unless you like boring, monotone lectures. All material is online but hard to get to or download. Does not use Vista. Tests are difficult and questions are too specific for this type of course. Too much material covered and can be overwhelming. Not a good professor. Be sure to get your caffeine intake!
Reads straight from powerpoint slides, doesn't speak clearly, and is not that excited about the subject matter

Gentleman teacher. Very enthused about his subject. Entertaining lectures. Tests aren't easy, but he grades on a curve. Come to class and you'll do ok. Course material is pretty much like 1101: science for dummies.

Nice professor. Nice man. Lots of opportunities for extra credit. So DO IT! Class is pretty boring. Shows videos sometimes..which is nice! Tests are difficult, but he always ends up curving them and has bonus questions on them too. The final was very challenging...so STUDY GROUPS are a must! I wish I would've had one.
Nice, nice man. Gives lots of extra credit questions on tests.
Not bad.  Easy class.  He just took his notes from an AP Science class at Westminister Private School

Actually the frog movie was the weirdest thing I've ever seen in my life. Easy class though. He's boring, but you can literally just get your notes at the beginning of class and then leave. Tests are easy. 5 points extra credit on tests and he curves.
BORING CLASS! Teacher is nice but really doesn't do a good job teaching. Gave out copies of his powerpoint presentations but even that didn't really help.

Too hard for a sat class. just dont take him, plz its not very hard but its too much for a gen ed, mayb it was bcx it waas on a sat 11am who knows, test wer harder than expected. hes a bore in class, the frog movie was the best instructional vid ive ever seen, hillarious, youll see
